primary_phone.department: City and County of Denver / Parking Violations Bureau
primary_phone.purpose: Confirm Phase-1 appeal mailing addresses and issuing authority routing.

sections.authority_name: City and County of Denver Parking Violations Bureau

serves.description: Parking citations issued by the City and County of Denver (excluding park citations).

how_to_recognize.notes: General parking citations in Denver usually list a numeric citation number and reference the Denver County Court.

submission_methods.notes: To dispute a Denver parking citation you must schedule and attend a final hearing in person at Denver County Court within 20 days of issuance; there is no mail or online appeal option.

appeal_mail_to.missing_reason: Denver parking citations must be contested in person at Denver County Court; the official site does not provide a mailing address for Phase-1 appeals.

confirm_by_phone.department: Denver County Court / Parking Violations Bureau
confirm_by_phone.purpose: Confirm in-person hearing requirements and verify there is no mailing address for appealing Denver parking citations.

verification.verified_source_note: Denver's Tickets and Disputes page states that to dispute a parking citation, you must schedule a final hearing in person at 1437 Bannock St., Room 135; there is no mail appeal option【837151970912746†L290-L317】.

serves.description: Administrative citations issued on park property (including PR-prefixed citations) under Denver Parks and Recreation.

how_to_recognize.notes: Park citations often begin with "PR-" and reference Denver Parks and Recreation.

submission_methods.notes: For citations beginning with PR-, appeals must be submitted by mail with a $25 check; other park citations may be appealed online.

confirm_by_phone.department: Denver Parks and Recreation / Citation Appeals
confirm_by_phone.purpose: Confirm that PR-coded citations must be appealed by mail and verify the mailing address and fee requirements.

verification.verified_source_note: The Appeal a Park Citation page explains that PR-XXXXXX citations must be appealed by mail and provides the mailing address for appeals【625743734571440†L338-L392】.

sections.canonical_section_name: University of Denver Parking & Mobility Services

serves.description: Citations issued on University of Denver campus property by the Department of Parking & Mobility Services.

how_to_recognize.notes: DU citations are campus-issued and may include a numeric citation number.

submission_methods.notes: Appeals must be filed via email or online. Paper appeals may be mailed, but the university does not list a mailing address for appeals.

appeal_mail_to.missing_reason: The University of Denver instructs appellants to appeal online or via email; if an appeal is written on paper it can be mailed in, but the site does not provide a mailing address【621489600830790†L125-L147】.

confirm_by_phone.department: University of Denver Parking & Mobility Services
confirm_by_phone.purpose: Confirm the mailing address for paper appeals and verify that appeals may be submitted via email or online.

verification.verified_source_note: The DU parking and mobility services site notes that appeals must be done via email or online; paper appeals may be mailed but no mailing address is provided【621489600830790†L125-L147】.

sections.authority_name: University of Colorado Denver / Anschutz Parking & Transportation Services

serves.description: Citations issued on CU Denver or Anschutz Medical Campus parking facilities.

how_to_recognize.notes: CU Denver citations may list a numeric citation number; appeal information is provided through the parking portal.

submission_methods.notes: Appeals must be submitted via the online citation appeal form within 14 days of issuance; payment by mail is accepted but appeals by mail are not.

appeal_mail_to.missing_reason: CU Denver and Anschutz parking websites require appeals to be submitted online and do not list a mailing address for appeals【131624671640123†L123-L146】【193864178754739†L203-L209】.

confirm_by_phone.purpose: Confirm that appeals must be submitted online and verify that no mailing address is available.

verification.verified_source_note: CU Denver and Anschutz citation pages state that appeals must be received online within 14 days and do not provide a mailing address for appeals【131624671640123†L123-L146】【193864178754739†L203-L209】.

sections.authority_name: Auraria Higher Education Center Parking & Transportation Services

serves.description: Parking citations issued on the Auraria Campus (serving Metropolitan State University of Denver, Community College of Denver, and CU Denver).

how_to_recognize.notes: Auraria Campus citations may list a numeric citation number and reference the campus parking office.

submission_methods.notes: Appeals must be submitted online within 45 days of citation issuance; payment may be mailed or made in person.

appeal_mail_to.missing_reason: Auraria Campus requires appeals to be submitted via its online portal and does not provide a mailing address for appeal submissions【550283808756354†L342-L379】.

confirm_by_phone.purpose: Confirm the online-only appeal process and verify that no mailing address is available for appeals.

verification.verified_source_note: The Auraria Campus parking citations page states that appeals must be submitted online within 45 days and lists a payment mailing address but not an appeal mailing address【550283808756354†L342-L379】.

serves.description: Parking citations issued on Regis University campus.

how_to_recognize.notes: Regis University citations use numeric identifiers and reference the campus parking office.

submission_methods.notes: First-level appeals must be submitted online through the Regis parking portal; if denied, a second-level appeal must be requested via email and requires an in-person hearing.

appeal_mail_to.missing_reason: Regis University parking policy states that appeals must be submitted online and does not provide a mailing address for appeals【938132267795439†L401-L417】.

confirm_by_phone.purpose: Confirm appeal procedures and verify that there is no mailing address for appeals.

verification.verified_source_note: Regis University parking policy indicates that first-level appeals must be submitted online within 14 days and does not mention a mailing address for appeals【938132267795439†L401-L417】.

blocking_issues: City of Denver parking appeals require in-person hearings and no mailing address is provided; confirmation needed.
University of Denver, CU Denver, Auraria Campus, and Regis University sections lack mailing addresses and rely on online appeal forms; confirmation needed.
known_gaps: Citation ID patterns for most authorities are based on limited information and have low confidence.
CU Denver, DU, Auraria Campus, and Regis University sections require follow-up to verify if any mail appeal addresses exist or if online-only appeals are correct.
